head.title: 2 Tie for Lead In Met Life Open

hedline.hl1: 2 Tie for Lead In Met Life Open

abstract.p: Craig Thomas and P J Cowan are tied after two rounds of Met Life/Met Golf Assn Open championship (S)

block.p: Craig Thomas, seeking his first title, shot a three-under-par 68 yesterday and moved into a tie for the top spot at 138 with P. J. Cowan after two rounds of the Met Life/Met Golf Association Open championship at the Mountain Ridge Country Club in West Caldwell, N.J.
Cowan, a three-time New York State Open winner, was one-under par at 70 after his first round of 68.

Craig Thomas, seeking his first title, shot a three-under-par 68 yesterday and moved into a tie for the top spot at 138 with P. J. Cowan after two rounds of the Met Life/Met Golf Association Open championship at the Mountain Ridge Country Club in West Caldwell, N.J.
Cowan, a three-time New York State Open winner, was one-under par at 70 after his first round of 68.

Jerry Courville Jr., an amateur who had a 67 for the first-round lead, posted a 72 for 139 and shared third place with four others. Among that group was Rick Hartmann, winner of the 1998 Met Open, who passed up the P.G.A Championship this week because of the recent death of his father.
